alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 5:06PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clackamas, east central Yamhill, southern Multnomah and southeastern Washington Counties through 545 PM PDT... At 506 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Metzger, or south of Portland Downtown, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size accumulating hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oregon City, Portland, Beaverton, Tigard, Lake Oswego, Tualatin, West Linn, Milwaukie, Wilsonville, Canby, Gladstone, Rivergrove, Oatfield, Garden Home-Whitford, Metzger, Jennings Lodge, Clackamas, Sherwood, Happy Valley and King City. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 283 and 299. Interstate 205 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills
